name: Jaime L. Garcia
text: When I was a kid, I used to think that airplanes were giant loading screens in the world, similar to how Castlevania: SOTN had those CD rooms between big chunks of the map.    The "Matrix world" (as it were) was busy loading the creatures and the terrain below, and you weren't really flying to a destination - you were just kept in a box until the world below had already loaded.
